Scenario1.Dialogue: It is an average Monday like any other, except you’ve decided to go camping by yourself for the week. After a long, grueling day of camping activities, you go back to your cabin and decide to treat yourself with your favorite food: lasagna. As you start cooking, you decide to rest on the couch for a few minutes, leaving your phone in the kitchen next to the oven. However, your utter lack of energy catches up to you, and you fall asleep. You then wake up to a strong smell of smoke in the air. What do you do next?
Scenario1.Dec1: Get up from the couch and investigate

inspect.Description: It's not the time to look around. Go investigate the smoke

Scenario2.Dialogue: You spring up from the couch and hurry to the source of the smell. You come across a gigantic fire from cooking your lasagna for too long. What do you do?

inspect.Description: YOUR HOUSE IS ON FIRE! STOP INSPECTING!

Scenario3.Dialogue: You tell yourself, “Everything’s fine. It’s probably from outside” and fall back asleep. Your cabin eventually collapses from a fire with you still inside. (Dead) *Take any sign of a possible dangerous situation seriously. Do not ignore it.

inspect.Description: No.

Scenario4.Dialogue: After noticing the fire, you run away to the nearest exit. You come across two doors that both lead to an exit. One door has smoking coming from the other side through the bottom, and the other one does not have any smoke near it. Which door do you approach?

inspect.Description: Your house is burning. It's time to leave, not inspect.

Scenario5.Dialogue: You do everything you possibly can to put out the flames, but there are simply too many to handle. You cannot keep up with the fire, and the house eventually collapses with you still inside. (Dead)*In a fire, do not stay in the building. It is important to get yourself as far away from the fire as possible. Do not attempt to put out large fires. It is more important that you keep yourself safe.

inspect.Description: Not the time to inspect.

Scenario6.Dialogue: In a moment of sheer panic, you run away from the fire to a room not currently burning down. You then hide, hoping that the fire will go away or someone will notice the fire and help. The flames eventually catch up to the room, and you die in the fire. (Dead)*In a fire, do not stay in the building. It is important to get yourself as far away from the fire as possible.

inspect.Description: Stop trying to inspect. This feature is for the chapters after this.

Scenario7.Dialogue: You approach the door with no smoke near it. You open the door, but are still confronted with smoke on the other side filling the hallway. How do you get through?

inspect.Description: You have a decision to make don't you? It's not the time to look around.

Scenario8.Dialogue: You approach the smoking door. What do you do next?

inspect.Description: There is nothing to see here. Go mess with the door.

Scenario9.Dialogue: You get low to the ground and crawl through the hallway, making sure that you do not inhale any smoke.

inspect.Description: You are crawling through a house fire. What is there to look at?

Scenario10.Dialogue: In an attempt to escape as quickly as possible, you run through the hallway, breathing in smoke in the process. *In this scenario, it is better to crawl to prevent you from breathing in smoke and potentially damaging your lungs.

inspect.Description: You need to escape! Stop looking around!

Scenario11.Dialogue: At the end of the hallway, you approach a window that you can use to escape. You open the window and crawl through, escaping the cabin and the fire inside.

Scenario12.Dialogue: You gently bring your hand towards the doorknob and feel that the doorknob is extremely hot. You realize that you cannot open the door without burning your hand, so you do not open it.
Scenario12.Dec1: Go to door with no smoke

inspect.Description: Aren't you trying to escape? Stop looking around!

Scenario13.Dialogue: You quickly and firmly grab the doorknob without realizing that it is extremely hot. You burn your hand and cannot manage to open the door. You then go to the other door.
Scenario13.Dec1: Go to door with no smoke

inspect.Description: Seriously? You are burning your hand on a doorknob right now and you decide to look around?

Scenario1.Dialogue: You managed to escape from the cabin, but the smell of smoke in the air is still strong. The fire continues to consume the rest of the cabin and will quickly spread to the rest of the campsite. You need to leave the site, but there is still time to gather some items that could be of use to you later. You quickly run to the front of the cabin to pick up your backpack and plan where to go next…

Scenario2.Dialogue: In the shed, you find a first aid kit, an axe, a flashlight, and a bucket.

inspect.Description: You look around and see the items listed before

Scenario3.Dialogue: In the deer hunting stand, you find an empty rifle, camo clothing, a knife, and a cooking pot. You notice a box of ammunition nearby, but there is only 1 bullet left, so you load the rifle with the last remaining bullet.

inspect.Description: You look around and see the items listed before

Scenario4.Dialogue: In the fire pit, there is no fire yet, but you manage to find a box of matches, an empty water bottle with no cap, some rope, and a half-eaten bag of marshmallows.

inspect.Description: You look around and see the items listed before.

Scenario5.Dialogue: The fire is spreading quickly, so you take the items you found and leave the area as quickly as possible. You must choose a direction to head towards
Scenario5.Dec2: Go to the West of the house
Scenario5.Dec3: Go to the South of the house

inspect.Description: You already grabbed as many items as you could, get away from the burning house now!

Scenario6.Dialogue: You head East and come across a forest. You notice 3 paths that will take you through the forest. The first path is cluttered with plants with leaves that are in groups of 3 with pointed tips and jagged edges. The second path contains very long and narrow green leaves and a few flowers of different colors. The third path contains plants with leaves that are in groups of 3 with vine-like stems. Which path will you take?

inspect.Description: You have a decision to make, there is nothing to pick up!

Scenario7.Dialogue: You head West and reach a river that heads North. The river is a good source of freshwater, but it is not a good area to make a shelter. What will you do?

inspect.Description: There is nothing worthwhile here to pick up

Scenario8.Dialogue: You head South and notice a very large collection of bushes. There could be berries here, and that could be a decent source of food. However, there is a large black bear in the distance. It is in between you and the berries, so you will have to deal with it somehow…

inspect.Description: Make a decision about the bear, now isn't the time to zone out.

Scenario9.Dialogue: You walk through the path, pushing aside all plants in your way. As you make your way through, you feel your skin start to irritate.

inspect.Description: You look around, and see a few things you could maybe pick up

Scenario10.Dialogue: You walk through the path, pushing aside all plants and leaves in your way.

inspect.Description: You see a few twigs and branches on the ground.

Scenario11.Dialogue: You walk through the path, pushing aside all plants in your way. As you make your way through, you feel your skin start to irritate.

inspect.Description: There is nothing here but a few twigs.

Scenario12.Dialogue: You come to a clearing in the forest, with no trees or bushes in the immediate vicinity. This looks like a good place to build a shelter.

Scenario13.Dialogue: You have something to hold water with, use the inventory option to fill it up so. You'll need to find a way to boil the water.

inspect.Description: Use your inventory to get the water

Scenario14.Dialogue: Fishing has not been implemented yet

inspect.Description: Nothing to inspect here.

Scenario15.Dialogue: You head North and notice a mountain range in the distance. Atop one of the mountains lies a radio tower that you could use to signal for help. However, it is far away, and you are not prepared for surviving the frigid temperatures. You are not yet ready to leave.

inspect.Description: Nothing of value here.

Scenario16.Dialogue: You get low to the ground and attempt to sneak around the bear, hoping that it won’t notice you. As you carefully and slowly make your way around, the bear does not seem to notice you there.

inspect.Description: You are sneaking around a bear, you need to be stealthy, no time to inspect

Scenario17.Dialogue: You now face the bear head-on as it growls and is preparing to attack you. What do you do?

inspect.Description: You are head to head with a bear. It isn't a good time to look around.

Scenario18.Dialogue: There is a tall tree nearby that you notice could be a way to avoid the bear’s attacks. As you make your way up the tree, you look below and notice the bear grab at the tree and start to climb after you.

inspect.Description: You are climbing a tree to try and escape a bear. Nothing to inspect here.

Scenario19.Dialogue: You start yelling towards the bear while waving your arms to make yourself look as big as possible. The bear becomes startled, but still advances towards you. You kick the bear in the face when it gets close while still yelling and waving your arms, and the bear jumps back and runs away.

inspect.Description: You are scaring away a bear and decide now is a good time to inspect? Really?

Scenario20.Dialogue: You drop to the ground and act dead, hoping that the bear will ignore you. However, the bear does not ignore you and attacks you while you are not prepared. (Dead)* Playing dead can be an effective way to avoid a grizzly bear attack, but it is not effective against black bears.

inspect.Description: You are literally dead. You cannot inspect while dead.

Scenario21.Dialogue: You continue climbing, but the bear is climbing much faster than you. It catches up to you and slashes at your leg. You then lose your balance, crashing to the ground and falling to your death. (Dead)

inspect.Description: You are trying to escape a bear, don't inspect.

Scenario22.Dialogue: Noticing the bear start to climb up the tree, you immediately drop down, knowing that you would not be able to escape. However, the fall was from fairly high up, so you hurt yourself.

inspect.Description: You just jumped from a tree to escape a bear, it isn't a good time to inspect.

Scenario23.Dialogue: You look around and see berries bushes everywhere. You should try using inspect to look at more.
Scenario23.Dec1: Go to a different part of of the berry forest.

inspect.Description: There are berries everywhere!

Scenario24.Dialogue: You move deeper into the berry brush, and continue to see different berries.
Scenario24.Dec2: Go back to the central area

inspect.Description: So many berries!

Scenario25.Dialogue: You start by gathering nearby logs to make the rectangular frame of the shelter. You then fill the frame with nearby leaves and pine branches to provide insulation. Next, you create an A-shaped frame over the shelter, using sticks and adjusting them on each side so that they meet at the top. Finally, you add a thick covering of leaves, sticks, and branches over the entire shelter to hold back any rain.

inspect.Description: Hooray, you built a shelter! But there isn't anything here to inspect
no. just no. the feature isn't even done yet.

Scenario27.Dialogue: You have a shelter now built in the clearing. It is a small collection of logs, sticks, and leaves, but it serves your basic needs. What do you do next?

inspect.Description: You are at your shelter, nothing to inspect here!
